trans-unit.source: Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure (GUI)
trans-unit.target: Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure (GUI)

trans-unit.source: Create an AlwaysOn Availability Group in Azure Virtual Machines. This tutorial primarily uses the user interface and tools rather than scripting.
trans-unit.target: Create an AlwaysOn Availability Group in Azure Virtual Machines. This tutorial primarily uses the user interface and tools rather than scripting.

trans-unit.source: Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure (GUI)
trans-unit.target: Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure (GUI)

trans-unit.source: This end-to-end tutorial shows you how to implement Availability Groups using SQL Server AlwaysOn running on Azure virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: This end-to-end tutorial shows you how to implement Availability Groups using SQL Server AlwaysOn running on Azure virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, there is a new gallery setup for AlwaysOn Availability Groups with a Listener.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, there is a new gallery setup for AlwaysOn Availability Groups with a Listener.

trans-unit.source: This configures everything you need for AlwaysOn Availability Groups automatically.
trans-unit.target: This configures everything you need for AlwaysOn Availability Groups automatically.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>SQL Server AlwaysOn Offering in Microsoft Azure Portal Gallery</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>SQL Server AlwaysOn Offering in Microsoft Azure Portal Gallery</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To use PowerShell, see the tutorial of the same scenario at <link><linkText>Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure with PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To use PowerShell, see the tutorial of the same scenario at <link><linkText>Configure AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure with PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: At the end of the tutorial, your SQL Server AlwaysOn solution in Azure will consist of the following elements:
trans-unit.target: At the end of the tutorial, your SQL Server AlwaysOn solution in Azure will consist of the following elements:

trans-unit.source: A virtual network containing multiple subnets, including a front-end and a back-end subnet
trans-unit.target: A virtual network containing multiple subnets, including a front-end and a back-end subnet

trans-unit.source: A domain controller with an Active Directory (AD) domain
trans-unit.target: A domain controller with an Active Directory (AD) domain

trans-unit.source: Two SQL Server VMs deployed to the back-end subnet and joined to the AD domain
trans-unit.target: Two SQL Server VMs deployed to the back-end subnet and joined to the AD domain

trans-unit.source: A 3-node WSFC cluster with the Node Majority quorum model
trans-unit.target: A 3-node WSFC cluster with the Node Majority quorum model

trans-unit.source: An availability group with two synchronous-commit replicas of an availability database
trans-unit.target: An availability group with two synchronous-commit replicas of an availability database

trans-unit.source: The figure below is a graphical representation of the solution.
trans-unit.target: The figure below is a graphical representation of the solution.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Test Lab Architecture for AG in Azure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Test Lab Architecture for AG in Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note that this is one possible configuration.
trans-unit.target: Note that this is one possible configuration.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can minimize the number of VMs for a two-replica availability group in order to save on compute hours in Azure by using the domain controller as the quorum file share witness in a 2-node WSFC cluster.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can minimize the number of VMs for a two-replica availability group in order to save on compute hours in Azure by using the domain controller as the quorum file share witness in a 2-node WSFC cluster.

trans-unit.source: This method reduces the VM count by one from the above configuration.
trans-unit.target: This method reduces the VM count by one from the above configuration.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes the following:

trans-unit.source: You already have an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: You already have an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: You already know how to provision a SQL Server VM from the virtual machine gallery using the GUI.
trans-unit.target: You already know how to provision a SQL Server VM from the virtual machine gallery using the GUI.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: You already have a solid understanding of AlwaysOn Availability Groups.
trans-unit.target: You already have a solid understanding of AlwaysOn Availability Groups.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>AlwaysOn Availability Groups (SQL Server)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>AlwaysOn Availability Groups (SQL Server)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you are interested in using AlwaysOn Availability Groups with SharePoint, also see <link><linkText>Configure SQL Server 2012 AlwaysOn Availability Groups for SharePoint 2013</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you are interested in using AlwaysOn Availability Groups with SharePoint, also see <link><linkText>Configure SQL Server 2012 AlwaysOn Availability Groups for SharePoint 2013</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create the Virtual Network and Domain Controller Server
trans-unit.target: Create the Virtual Network and Domain Controller Server

trans-unit.source: You begin with a new Azure trial account.
trans-unit.target: You begin with a new Azure trial account.

trans-unit.source: Once you have finished your account setup, you should be in the home screen of the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Once you have finished your account setup, you should be in the home screen of the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Click the New button at the lower-left corner of the page, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Click the New button at the lower-left corner of the page, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click New in the Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click New in the Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Network Services, then click Virtual Network, and then click Custom Create, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Click Network Services, then click Virtual Network, and then click Custom Create, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create Virtual Network</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create Virtual Network</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the CREATE A VIRTUAL NETWORK dialog, create a new virtual network by stepping through the pages with the settings below.
trans-unit.target: In the CREATE A VIRTUAL NETWORK dialog, create a new virtual network by stepping through the pages with the settings below.

trans-unit.source: Page
trans-unit.target: Page

trans-unit.source: Settings
trans-unit.target: Settings

trans-unit.source: Virtual Network Details
trans-unit.target: Virtual Network Details

trans-unit.source: NAME = ContosoNETREGION = West US
trans-unit.target: NAME = ContosoNETREGION = West US

trans-unit.source: DNS Servers and VPN Connectivity
trans-unit.target: DNS Servers and VPN Connectivity

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: Virtual Network Address Spaces
trans-unit.target: Virtual Network Address Spaces

trans-unit.source: Settings are shown in the screenshot below: <linkText>Create Virtual Network</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Settings are shown in the screenshot below: <linkText>Create Virtual Network</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next, you create the VM you will use as the domain controller (DC).
trans-unit.target: Next, you create the VM you will use as the domain controller (DC).

trans-unit.source: Click New again, then Compute, then Virtual Machine, and then From Gallery, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Click New again, then Compute, then Virtual Machine, and then From Gallery, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a VM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a VM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the CREATE A VIRTUAL MACHINE dialog, configure a new VM by stepping through the pages with the settings below.
trans-unit.target: In the CREATE A VIRTUAL MACHINE dialog, configure a new VM by stepping through the pages with the settings below.

trans-unit.source: Page
trans-unit.target: Page

trans-unit.source: Settings
trans-unit.target: Settings

trans-unit.source: Select the virtual machine operating system
trans-unit.target: Select the virtual machine operating system

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine configuration
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine configuration

trans-unit.source: VERSION RELEASE DATE = (latest)VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME = ContosoDCTIER = BASICSIZE = A2 (2 cores)NEW USER NAME = AzureAdminNEW PASSWORD = Contoso!000CONFIRM = Contoso!000
trans-unit.target: VERSION RELEASE DATE = (latest)VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME = ContosoDCTIER = BASICSIZE = A2 (2 cores)NEW USER NAME = AzureAdminNEW PASSWORD = Contoso!000CONFIRM = Contoso!000

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine configuration
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine configuration

trans-unit.source: CLOUD SERVICE = Create a new cloud serviceCLOUD SERVICE DNS NAME = A unique cloud service nameDNS NAME = A unique name (ex: ContosoDC123)REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK = ContosoNETVIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS = Back(10.10.2.0/24)STORAGE ACCOUNT = Use an automatically generated storage accountAVAILABILITY SET = (None)
trans-unit.target: CLOUD SERVICE = Create a new cloud serviceCLOUD SERVICE DNS NAME = A unique cloud service nameDNS NAME = A unique name (ex: ContosoDC123)REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK = ContosoNETVIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS = Back(10.10.2.0/24)STORAGE ACCOUNT = Use an automatically generated storage accountAVAILABILITY SET = (None)

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine options
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine options

trans-unit.source: Use defaults
trans-unit.target: Use defaults

trans-unit.source: Once you finish configuring the new VM, wait for the VM to be provsioned.
trans-unit.target: Once you finish configuring the new VM, wait for the VM to be provsioned.

trans-unit.source: This process takes some time to complete, and if you click to the Virtual Machine tab in the Azure portal, you can see ContosoDC cycling states from Starting (Provisioning) to Stopped, Starting, Running (Provisioning), and finally Running.
trans-unit.target: This process takes some time to complete, and if you click to the Virtual Machine tab in the Azure portal, you can see ContosoDC cycling states from Starting (Provisioning) to Stopped, Starting, Running (Provisioning), and finally Running.

trans-unit.source: The DC server is now successfully provisioned.
trans-unit.target: The DC server is now successfully provisioned.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will configure the Active Directory domain on this DC server.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will configure the Active Directory domain on this DC server.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Domain Controller
trans-unit.target: Configure the Domain Controller

trans-unit.source: In the following steps, you configure the ContosoDC machine as a domain controller for corp.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: In the following steps, you configure the ContosoDC machine as a domain controller for corp.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: In the portal, select the ContosoDC machine.
trans-unit.target: In the portal, select the ContosoDC machine.

trans-unit.source: On the Dashboard tab, click Connect to open an RDP file for remote desktop access.
trans-unit.target: On the Dashboard tab, click Connect to open an RDP file for remote desktop access.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect to Vritual Machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect to Vritual Machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Log in with your configured administrator account (\AzureAdmin) and password (Contoso!000).
trans-unit.target: Log in with your configured administrator account (\AzureAdmin) and password (Contoso!000).

trans-unit.source: By default, the Server Manager dashboard should be displayed.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Server Manager dashboard should be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Click the Add roles and features link on the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Click the Add roles and features link on the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Server Explorer Add Roles</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Server Explorer Add Roles</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Next until you get to the Server Roles section.
trans-unit.target: Select Next until you get to the Server Roles section.

trans-unit.source: Select the Active Directory Domain Services and DNS Server roles.
trans-unit.target: Select the Active Directory Domain Services and DNS Server roles.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, add any additional features required by these roles.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, add any additional features required by these roles.

trans-unit.source: You will get a validation warning that there is no static IP address.
trans-unit.target: You will get a validation warning that there is no static IP address.

trans-unit.source: If you are testing the configuration, click continue.
trans-unit.target: If you are testing the configuration, click continue.

trans-unit.source: For production scenarios <link><linkText>use PowerShell to set the static IP address of the domain controller machine</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For production scenarios <link><linkText>use PowerShell to set the static IP address of the domain controller machine</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Roles Dialog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Roles Dialog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Next until you reach the Confirmation section.
trans-unit.target: Click Next until you reach the Confirmation section.

trans-unit.source: Select the Restart the destination server automatically if required checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Select the Restart the destination server automatically if required checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Install.
trans-unit.target: Click Install.

trans-unit.source: After the features finish installing, return to the Server Manager dashboard.
trans-unit.target: After the features finish installing, return to the Server Manager dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Select the new AD DS option on the left-hand pane.
trans-unit.target: Select the new AD DS option on the left-hand pane.

trans-unit.source: Click the More link on the yellow warning bar.
trans-unit.target: Click the More link on the yellow warning bar.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>AD DS dialog on DNS Server VM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>AD DS dialog on DNS Server VM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Action column of the All Server Task Details dialog, click Promote this server to a domain controller.
trans-unit.target: In the Action column of the All Server Task Details dialog, click Promote this server to a domain controller.

trans-unit.source: In the Active Directory Domain Services Configuration Wizard, use the following values:
trans-unit.target: In the Active Directory Domain Services Configuration Wizard, use the following values:

trans-unit.source: Page
trans-unit.target: Page

trans-unit.source: Setting
trans-unit.target: Setting

trans-unit.source: Deployment Configuration
trans-unit.target: Deployment Configuration

trans-unit.source: Add a new forest = SelectedRoot domain name = corp.contoso.com
trans-unit.target: Add a new forest = SelectedRoot domain name = corp.contoso.com

trans-unit.source: Domain Controller Options
trans-unit.target: Domain Controller Options

trans-unit.source: Password = Contoso!000Confirm Password = Contoso!000
trans-unit.target: Password = Contoso!000Confirm Password = Contoso!000

trans-unit.source: Click Next to go through the other pages in the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click Next to go through the other pages in the wizard.

trans-unit.source: On the Prerequisites Check page, verify that you see the following message: All prerequisite checks passed successfully.
trans-unit.target: On the Prerequisites Check page, verify that you see the following message: All prerequisite checks passed successfully.

trans-unit.source: Note that you should review any applicable warning messages, but it is possible to continue with the install.
trans-unit.target: Note that you should review any applicable warning messages, but it is possible to continue with the install.

trans-unit.source: Click Install.
trans-unit.target: Click Install.

trans-unit.source: The ContosoDC virtual machine will automatically reboot.
trans-unit.target: The ContosoDC virtual machine will automatically reboot.

trans-unit.source: Configure Domain Accounts
trans-unit.target: Configure Domain Accounts

trans-unit.source: The next steps configure the Active Directory (AD) accounts for later use.
trans-unit.target: The next steps configure the Active Directory (AD) accounts for later use.

trans-unit.source: Log back into the ContosoDC machine.
trans-unit.target: Log back into the ContosoDC machine.

trans-unit.source: In Server Manager select Tools and then click Active Directory Administrative Center.
trans-unit.target: In Server Manager select Tools and then click Active Directory Administrative Center.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory Administrative Center</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory Administrative Center</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Active Directory Administrative Center select corp (local) from the left pane.
trans-unit.target: In the Active Directory Administrative Center select corp (local) from the left pane.

trans-unit.source: On the right Tasks pane, select New and then click User.
trans-unit.target: On the right Tasks pane, select New and then click User.

trans-unit.source: Use the following settings:
trans-unit.target: Use the following settings:

trans-unit.source: Setting
trans-unit.target: Setting

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: First Name
trans-unit.target: First Name

trans-unit.source: Install
trans-unit.target: Install

trans-unit.source: User SamAccountName
trans-unit.target: User SamAccountName

trans-unit.source: Install
trans-unit.target: Install

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: Contoso!000
trans-unit.target: Contoso!000

trans-unit.source: Confirm password
trans-unit.target: Confirm password

trans-unit.source: Contoso!000
trans-unit.target: Contoso!000

trans-unit.source: Other password options
trans-unit.target: Other password options

trans-unit.source: Selected
trans-unit.target: Selected

trans-unit.source: Password never expires
trans-unit.target: Password never expires

trans-unit.source: Checked
trans-unit.target: Checked

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the Install user.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to create the Install user.

trans-unit.source: This account will be used to configure the failover cluster and the availability group.
trans-unit.target: This account will be used to configure the failover cluster and the availability group.

trans-unit.source: Create two additional users with the same steps: CORP\SQLSvc1 and CORP\SQLSvc2.
trans-unit.target: Create two additional users with the same steps: CORP\SQLSvc1 and CORP\SQLSvc2.

trans-unit.source: These accounts will be used for the SQL Server instances.Next, you need to give CORP\Install the necessary permissions for configuring Windows Service Failover Clustering (WSFC).
trans-unit.target: These accounts will be used for the SQL Server instances.Next, you need to give CORP\Install the necessary permissions for configuring Windows Service Failover Clustering (WSFC).

trans-unit.source: In the Active Directory Administrative Center, select corp (local) in the left pane.
trans-unit.target: In the Active Directory Administrative Center, select corp (local) in the left pane.

trans-unit.source: Then in the right-hand Tasks pane, click Properties.
trans-unit.target: Then in the right-hand Tasks pane, click Properties.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>CORP User Properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>CORP User Properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Extensions, and then click the Advanced button on the Security tab.
trans-unit.target: Select Extensions, and then click the Advanced button on the Security tab.

trans-unit.source: On the Advanced Security Settings for corp dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Advanced Security Settings for corp dialog.

trans-unit.source: Click Add.
trans-unit.target: Click Add.

trans-unit.source: Click Select a principal.
trans-unit.target: Click Select a principal.

trans-unit.source: Then search for CORP\Install.
trans-unit.target: Then search for CORP\Install.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: Select the Read all properties and Create Computer objects permissions.
trans-unit.target: Select the Read all properties and Create Computer objects permissions.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Corp User Permissions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Corp User Permissions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click OK, and then click OK again.
trans-unit.target: Click OK, and then click OK again.

trans-unit.source: Close the corp properties window.
trans-unit.target: Close the corp properties window.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have finished configuring Active Directory and the user objects, you will create three SQL Server VMs and join them to this domain.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have finished configuring Active Directory and the user objects, you will create three SQL Server VMs and join them to this domain.

trans-unit.source: Create the SQL Server VMs
trans-unit.target: Create the SQL Server VMs

trans-unit.source: Next, create three VMs, including a WSFC cluster node and two SQL Server VMs.
trans-unit.target: Next, create three VMs, including a WSFC cluster node and two SQL Server VMs.

trans-unit.source: To create each of the VMs, go back to the Azure Portal, click New, Compute, Virtual Machine, and then From Gallery.
trans-unit.target: To create each of the VMs, go back to the Azure Portal, click New, Compute, Virtual Machine, and then From Gallery.

trans-unit.source: Then use the templates in the following table to help you create the VMs.
trans-unit.target: Then use the templates in the following table to help you create the VMs.

trans-unit.source: Page
trans-unit.target: Page

trans-unit.source: VM1
trans-unit.target: VM1

trans-unit.source: VM2
trans-unit.target: VM2

trans-unit.source: VM3
trans-unit.target: VM3

trans-unit.source: Select the virtual machine operating system
trans-unit.target: Select the virtual machine operating system

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2014 RTM Enterprise
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2014 RTM Enterprise

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2014 RTM Enterprise
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2014 RTM Enterprise

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine configuration
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine configuration

trans-unit.target: VERSION RELEASE DATE = (latest)VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME = ContosoWSFCNodeTIER = BASICSIZE = A2 (2 cores)NEW USER NAME = AzureAdminNEW PASSWORD = Contoso!000CONFIRM = Contoso!000

trans-unit.source: VERSION RELEASE DATE = (latest)VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME = ContosoSQL2TIER = BASICSIZE = A3 (4 cores)NEW USER NAME = AzureAdminNEW PASSWORD = Contoso!000CONFIRM = Contoso!000

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine configuration
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine configuration

trans-unit.source: CLOUD SERVICE = Previously Created Unique Cloud Service DNS Name (ex: ContosoDC123)REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK = ContosoNETVIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS = Back(10.10.2.0/24)STORAGE ACCOUNT = Use an automatically generated storage accountAVAILABILITY SET = Create an availability setAVAILABILITY SET NAME = SQLHADR
trans-unit.target: CLOUD SERVICE = Previously Created Unique Cloud Service DNS Name (ex: ContosoDC123)REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK = ContosoNETVIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS = Back(10.10.2.0/24)STORAGE ACCOUNT = Use an automatically generated storage accountAVAILABILITY SET = Create an availability setAVAILABILITY SET NAME = SQLHADR

trans-unit.source: CLOUD SERVICE = Previously Created Unique Cloud Service DNS Name (ex: ContosoDC123)REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK = ContosoNETVIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS = Back(10.10.2.0/24)STORAGE ACCOUNT = Use an automatically generated storage accountAVAILABILITY SET = SQLHADR (You can also configure the availability set after the machine has been created.
trans-unit.target: CLOUD SERVICE = Previously Created Unique Cloud Service DNS Name (ex: ContosoDC123)REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK = ContosoNETVIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS = Back(10.10.2.0/24)STORAGE ACCOUNT = Use an automatically generated storage accountAVAILABILITY SET = SQLHADR (You can also configure the availability set after the machine has been created.

trans-unit.source: All three machines should be assigned to the SQLHADR availability set.)

trans-unit.source: CLOUD SERVICE = Previously Created Unique Cloud Service DNS Name (ex: ContosoDC123)REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK = ContosoNETVIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS = Back(10.10.2.0/24)STORAGE ACCOUNT = Use an automatically generated storage accountAVAILABILITY SET = SQLHADR (You can also configure the availability set after the machine has been created.
trans-unit.target: CLOUD SERVICE = Previously Created Unique Cloud Service DNS Name (ex: ContosoDC123)REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK = ContosoNETVIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS = Back(10.10.2.0/24)STORAGE ACCOUNT = Use an automatically generated storage accountAVAILABILITY SET = SQLHADR (You can also configure the availability set after the machine has been created.

trans-unit.source: All three machines should be assigned to the SQLHADR availability set.)
trans-unit.target: All three machines should be assigned to the SQLHADR availability set.)

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine options
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine options

trans-unit.source: Use defaults
trans-unit.target: Use defaults

trans-unit.source: Use defaults
trans-unit.target: Use defaults

trans-unit.source: Use defaults
trans-unit.target: Use defaults

trans-unit.source: Once the three VMs are fully provisioned, you need to join them to the corp.contoso.com domain and grant CORP\Install administrative rights to the machines.
trans-unit.target: Once the three VMs are fully provisioned, you need to join them to the corp.contoso.com domain and grant CORP\Install administrative rights to the machines.

trans-unit.source: To do this, use the following steps for each of the three VMs.
trans-unit.target: To do this, use the following steps for each of the three VMs.

trans-unit.source: First, change the preferred DNS server address.
trans-unit.target: First, change the preferred DNS server address.

trans-unit.source: Start by downloading each VM's remote desktop (RDP) file to your local directory by selecting the VM in the list and clicking the Connect button.
trans-unit.target: Start by downloading each VM's remote desktop (RDP) file to your local directory by selecting the VM in the list and clicking the Connect button.

trans-unit.source: To select a VM, click anywhere but the first cell in the row, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: To select a VM, click anywhere but the first cell in the row, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Download the RDP File</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Download the RDP File</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Launch the RDP file you downloaded and log into the VM using your configured administrator account (BUILTIN\AzureAdmin) and password (Contoso!000).
trans-unit.target: Launch the RDP file you downloaded and log into the VM using your configured administrator account (BUILTIN\AzureAdmin) and password (Contoso!000).

trans-unit.source: Once you are logged in, you should see the Server Manager dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Once you are logged in, you should see the Server Manager dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Click Local Server in the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click Local Server in the left pane.

trans-unit.source: Select the IPv4 address assigned by DHCP, IPv6 enabled link.
trans-unit.target: Select the IPv4 address assigned by DHCP, IPv6 enabled link.

trans-unit.source: In the Network Connections window, select the network icon.
trans-unit.target: In the Network Connections window, select the network icon.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Change the VM Preferred DNS Server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Change the VM Preferred DNS Server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the command bar, click Change the settings of this connection (depending on the size of your window, you might have to click the double right arrow to see this command).
trans-unit.target: On the command bar, click Change the settings of this connection (depending on the size of your window, you might have to click the double right arrow to see this command).

trans-unit.source: Select Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4) and click Properties.
trans-unit.target: Select Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4) and click Properties.

trans-unit.source: Select Use the following DNS server addresses and specify 10.10.2.4 in Preferred DNS server.
trans-unit.target: Select Use the following DNS server addresses and specify 10.10.2.4 in Preferred DNS server.

trans-unit.source: The address 10.10.2.4 is the address assigned to a VM in the 10.10.2.0/24 subnet in an Azure virtual network, and that VM is ContosoDC.
trans-unit.target: The address 10.10.2.4 is the address assigned to a VM in the 10.10.2.0/24 subnet in an Azure virtual network, and that VM is ContosoDC.

trans-unit.source: To verify ContosoDC's IP address, use the nslookup contosodc in the command prompt, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: To verify ContosoDC's IP address, use the nslookup contosodc in the command prompt, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use NSLOOKUP to find IP address for DC</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use NSLOOKUP to find IP address for DC</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click OK and then Close to commit the changes.
trans-unit.target: Click OK and then Close to commit the changes.

trans-unit.source: You are now able to join the VM to corp.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: You are now able to join the VM to corp.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: Back in the Local Server window, click the WORKGROUP link.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Local Server window, click the WORKGROUP link.

trans-unit.source: In the Computer Name section, click Change.
trans-unit.target: In the Computer Name section, click Change.

trans-unit.source: Select the Domain check box and type corp.contoso.com in the text box.
trans-unit.target: Select the Domain check box and type corp.contoso.com in the text box.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Windows Security popup dialog, specify the credentials for the default domain administrator account (CORP\AzureAdmin) and the password (Contoso!000).
trans-unit.target: In the Windows Security popup dialog, specify the credentials for the default domain administrator account (CORP\AzureAdmin) and the password (Contoso!000).

trans-unit.source: When you see the "Welcome to the corp.contoso.com domain" message, click OK.
trans-unit.target: When you see the "Welcome to the corp.contoso.com domain" message, click OK.

trans-unit.source: Click Close, and then click Restart Now in the popup dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click Close, and then click Restart Now in the popup dialog.

trans-unit.source: Add the Corp\Install user as an administrator on each VM:
trans-unit.target: Add the Corp\Install user as an administrator on each VM:

trans-unit.source: Wait until the VM is restarted, then launch the RDP file again to log into the VM using the BUILTIN\AzureAdmin account.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the VM is restarted, then launch the RDP file again to log into the VM using the BUILTIN\AzureAdmin account.

trans-unit.source: In Server Manager select Tools, and then click Computer Management.
trans-unit.target: In Server Manager select Tools, and then click Computer Management.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Computer Management</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Computer Management</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Computer Management window, expand Local Users and Groups, and then select Groups.
trans-unit.target: In the Computer Management window, expand Local Users and Groups, and then select Groups.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the Administrators group.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the Administrators group.

trans-unit.source: In the Administrators Properties dialog, click the Add button.
trans-unit.target: In the Administrators Properties dialog, click the Add button.

trans-unit.source: Enter the user CORP\Install, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Enter the user CORP\Install, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: When prompted for credentials, use the AzureAdmin account with the Contoso!000 password.
trans-unit.target: When prompted for credentials, use the AzureAdmin account with the Contoso!000 password.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Administrator Properties dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to close the Administrator Properties dialog.

trans-unit.source: Add the Failover Clustering feature to each VM.
trans-unit.target: Add the Failover Clustering feature to each VM.

trans-unit.source: In the Server Manager dashboard, click Add roles and features.
trans-unit.target: In the Server Manager dashboard, click Add roles and features.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Roles and Features Wizard, click Next until you get to the Features page.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Roles and Features Wizard, click Next until you get to the Features page.

trans-unit.source: Select Failover Clustering.
trans-unit.target: Select Failover Clustering.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, add any other dependent features.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, add any other dependent features.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Failover Clustering Feature to VM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Failover Clustering Feature to VM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Next, and then click Install on the Confirmation page.
trans-unit.target: Click Next, and then click Install on the Confirmation page.

trans-unit.source: When the Failover Clustering feature installation is completed, click Close.
trans-unit.target: When the Failover Clustering feature installation is completed, click Close.

trans-unit.source: Log out of the VM.
trans-unit.target: Log out of the VM.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the steps in this section for all three servers -- ContosoWSFCNode, ContosoSQL1, and ContosoSQL2.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the steps in this section for all three servers -- ContosoWSFCNode, ContosoSQL1, and ContosoSQL2.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Server VMs are now provisioned and running, but they are installed with SQL Server with default options.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Server VMs are now provisioned and running, but they are installed with SQL Server with default options.

trans-unit.source: Create the WSFC Cluster
trans-unit.target: Create the WSFC Cluster

trans-unit.source: In this section, you create the WSFC cluster that will host the availability group you will create later.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you create the WSFC cluster that will host the availability group you will create later.

trans-unit.source: By now, you should have done the following to each of the three VMs you will use in the WSFC cluster:
trans-unit.target: By now, you should have done the following to each of the three VMs you will use in the WSFC cluster:

trans-unit.source: Fully provisioned in Azure
trans-unit.target: Fully provisioned in Azure

trans-unit.source: Joined VM to the domain
trans-unit.target: Joined VM to the domain

trans-unit.source: Added CORP\Install to the local Administrators group
trans-unit.target: Added CORP\Install to the local Administrators group

trans-unit.source: Added the Failover Clustering feature
trans-unit.target: Added the Failover Clustering feature

trans-unit.source: All these are prerequisites on each VM before you can join it to the WSFC cluster.
trans-unit.target: All these are prerequisites on each VM before you can join it to the WSFC cluster.

trans-unit.source: Also, note that the Azure virtual network does not behave in the same way as an on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: Also, note that the Azure virtual network does not behave in the same way as an on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: You need to create the cluster in the following order:
trans-unit.target: You need to create the cluster in the following order:

trans-unit.source: Create a single-node cluster on one of the nodes (ContosoSQL1).
trans-unit.target: Create a single-node cluster on one of the nodes (ContosoSQL1).

trans-unit.source: Modify the cluster IP address to an unused IP address (10.10.2.101).
trans-unit.target: Modify the cluster IP address to an unused IP address (10.10.2.101).

trans-unit.source: Bring the cluster name online.
trans-unit.target: Bring the cluster name online.

trans-unit.source: Add the other nodes (ContosoSQL2 and ContosoWSFCNode).
trans-unit.target: Add the other nodes (ContosoSQL2 and ContosoWSFCNode).

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps below to accomplish these tasks that fully configures the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps below to accomplish these tasks that fully configures the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Launch the RDP file for ContosoSQL1 and log in using the domain account CORP\Install.
trans-unit.target: Launch the RDP file for ContosoSQL1 and log in using the domain account CORP\Install.

trans-unit.source: In the Server Manager dashboard, select Tools, and then click Failover Cluster Manager.
trans-unit.target: In the Server Manager dashboard, select Tools, and then click Failover Cluster Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, right-click Failover Cluster Manager, and then click Create a Cluster, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, right-click Failover Cluster Manager, and then click Create a Cluster, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create Cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create Cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Create Cluster Wizard, create a one-node cluster by stepping through the pages with the settings below:
trans-unit.target: In the Create Cluster Wizard, create a one-node cluster by stepping through the pages with the settings below:

trans-unit.source: Page
trans-unit.target: Page

trans-unit.source: Settings
trans-unit.target: Settings

trans-unit.source: Before You Begin
trans-unit.target: Before You Begin

trans-unit.source: Use defaults
trans-unit.target: Use defaults

trans-unit.source: Select Servers
trans-unit.target: Select Servers

trans-unit.source: Type ContosoSQL1 in Enter server name and click Add
trans-unit.target: Type ContosoSQL1 in Enter server name and click Add

trans-unit.source: Validation Warning
trans-unit.target: Validation Warning

trans-unit.source: Select **No.
trans-unit.target: Select **No.

trans-unit.source: I do not require support from Microsoft for this cluster, and therefore do not want to run the validation tests.
trans-unit.target: I do not require support from Microsoft for this cluster, and therefore do not want to run the validation tests.

trans-unit.source: When I click Next, continue creating the cluster**.
trans-unit.target: When I click Next, continue creating the cluster**.

trans-unit.source: Access Point for Administering the Cluster
trans-unit.target: Access Point for Administering the Cluster

trans-unit.source: Type Cluster1 in Cluster Name
trans-unit.target: Type Cluster1 in Cluster Name

trans-unit.source: Confirmation
trans-unit.target: Confirmation

trans-unit.source: Use defaults unless you are using Storage Spaces.
trans-unit.target: Use defaults unless you are using Storage Spaces.

trans-unit.source: See the note following this table.
trans-unit.target: See the note following this table.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Storage Spaces, which groups multiple disks into storage pools, you must uncheck the Add all eligible storage to the cluster checkbox on the Confirmation page.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Storage Spaces, which groups multiple disks into storage pools, you must uncheck the Add all eligible storage to the cluster checkbox on the Confirmation page.

trans-unit.source: If you do not uncheck this option, the virtual disks will be detached during the clustering process.
trans-unit.target: If you do not uncheck this option, the virtual disks will be detached during the clustering process.

trans-unit.source: As a result, they will also not appear in Disk Manager or Explorer until the storage spaces are removed from cluster and reattached using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: As a result, they will also not appear in Disk Manager or Explorer until the storage spaces are removed from cluster and reattached using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: In the left-pane, expand Failover Cluster Manager, and then click Cluster1.corp.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: In the left-pane, expand Failover Cluster Manager, and then click Cluster1.corp.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: In the center pane, scroll down to Cluster Core Resources section and expand the Name: Clutser1 details.
trans-unit.target: In the center pane, scroll down to Cluster Core Resources section and expand the Name: Clutser1 details.

trans-unit.source: You should see both the Name and the IP Address resources in the Failed state.
trans-unit.target: You should see both the Name and the IP Address resources in the Failed state.

trans-unit.source: The IP address resource cannot be brought online because the cluster is assigned the same IP address as that of the machine itself, which is a duplicate address.
trans-unit.target: The IP address resource cannot be brought online because the cluster is assigned the same IP address as that of the machine itself, which is a duplicate address.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the failed IP Address resource, and then click Properties.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the failed IP Address resource, and then click Properties.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cluster Properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cluster Properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Static IP Address and specify 10.10.2.101 in the Address text box.
trans-unit.target: Select Static IP Address and specify 10.10.2.101 in the Address text box.

trans-unit.source: Then, click OK.
trans-unit.target: Then, click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the Cluster Core Resources section, right-click Name: Cluster1 and click Bring Online.
trans-unit.target: In the Cluster Core Resources section, right-click Name: Cluster1 and click Bring Online.

trans-unit.source: Then, wait until both resources are online.
trans-unit.target: Then, wait until both resources are online.

trans-unit.source: When the cluster name resource comes online, it updates the DC server with a new AD computer account.
trans-unit.target: When the cluster name resource comes online, it updates the DC server with a new AD computer account.

trans-unit.source: This AD account will be used to run the availability group clustered service later.
trans-unit.target: This AD account will be used to run the availability group clustered service later.

trans-unit.source: Finally, you add the remaining nodes to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you add the remaining nodes to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: In the browser tree, right-click Cluster1.corp.contoso.com and click Add Node, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: In the browser tree, right-click Cluster1.corp.contoso.com and click Add Node, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Node to the Cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Node to the Cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Add Node Wizard, click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Node Wizard, click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Select Servers page, add ContosoSQL2 and ContosoWSFCNode to the list by typing the server name in Enter server name and then clicking Add.
trans-unit.target: In the Select Servers page, add ContosoSQL2 and ContosoWSFCNode to the list by typing the server name in Enter server name and then clicking Add.

trans-unit.source: When you are done, click Next.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Validation Warning page, click No (in a production scenario you should perform the validation tests).
trans-unit.target: In the Validation Warning page, click No (in a production scenario you should perform the validation tests).

trans-unit.source: Then, click Next.
trans-unit.target: Then, click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Confirmation page, click Next to add the nodes.
trans-unit.target: In the Confirmation page, click Next to add the nodes.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Storage Spaces, which groups multiple disks into storage pools, you must uncheck the Add all eligible storage to the cluster checkbox.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Storage Spaces, which groups multiple disks into storage pools, you must uncheck the Add all eligible storage to the cluster checkbox.

trans-unit.source: If you do not uncheck this option, the virtual disks will be detached during the clustering process.
trans-unit.target: If you do not uncheck this option, the virtual disks will be detached during the clustering process.

trans-unit.source: As a result, they will also not appear in Disk Manager or Explorer until the storage spaces are removed from cluster and reattached using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: As a result, they will also not appear in Disk Manager or Explorer until the storage spaces are removed from cluster and reattached using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Once the nodes are added to the cluster, click Finish.
trans-unit.target: Once the nodes are added to the cluster, click Finish.

trans-unit.source: Failover Cluster Manager should now show that your cluster has three nodes and list them in the Nodes container.
trans-unit.target: Failover Cluster Manager should now show that your cluster has three nodes and list them in the Nodes container.

trans-unit.source: Log out of the remote desktop session.
trans-unit.target: Log out of the remote desktop session.

trans-unit.source: Prepare the SQL Server Instances for Availability Group
trans-unit.target: Prepare the SQL Server Instances for Availability Group

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will do the following on both ContosoSQL1 and contosoSQL2:
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will do the following on both ContosoSQL1 and contosoSQL2:

trans-unit.source: Add a login for NT AUTHORITY\System with a necessary permissions set to the default SQL Server instance
trans-unit.target: Add a login for NT AUTHORITY\System with a necessary permissions set to the default SQL Server instance

trans-unit.source: Add CORP\Install as a sysadmin role to the default SQL Server instance
trans-unit.target: Add CORP\Install as a sysadmin role to the default SQL Server instance

trans-unit.source: Open the firewall for remote access of SQL Server
trans-unit.target: Open the firewall for remote access of SQL Server

trans-unit.source: Enable the AlwaysOn Availability Groups feature
trans-unit.target: Enable the AlwaysOn Availability Groups feature

trans-unit.source: Change the SQL Server service account to CORP\SQLSvc1 and CORP\SQLSvc2, respectively
trans-unit.target: Change the SQL Server service account to CORP\SQLSvc1 and CORP\SQLSvc2, respectively

trans-unit.source: These actions can be performed in any order.
trans-unit.target: These actions can be performed in any order.

trans-unit.source: Nevertheless, the steps below will walk through them in order.
trans-unit.target: Nevertheless, the steps below will walk through them in order.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps for both ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2:
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps for both ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2:

trans-unit.source: If you have not logged out of the remote desktop session for the VM, do so now.
trans-unit.target: If you have not logged out of the remote desktop session for the VM, do so now.

trans-unit.source: Launch the RDP files for ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2 and log in as BUILTIN\AzureAdmin.
trans-unit.target: Launch the RDP files for ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2 and log in as BUILTIN\AzureAdmin.

trans-unit.source: First, add NT AUTHORITY\System to the SQL Server logins and with necessary permissions.
trans-unit.target: First, add NT AUTHORITY\System to the SQL Server logins and with necessary permissions.

trans-unit.source: Launch SQL Server Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: Launch SQL Server Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect to connect to the default SQL Server instance.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect to connect to the default SQL Server instance.

trans-unit.source: In Object Explorer, expand Security, and then expand Logins.
trans-unit.target: In Object Explorer, expand Security, and then expand Logins.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the NT AUTHORITY\System login, and click Properties.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the NT AUTHORITY\System login, and click Properties.

trans-unit.source: In the Securables page, for the local server, select Grant for the following permissions and click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the Securables page, for the local server, select Grant for the following permissions and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Alter any availability group
trans-unit.target: Alter any availability group

trans-unit.source: Connect SQL
trans-unit.target: Connect SQL

trans-unit.source: View server state
trans-unit.target: View server state

trans-unit.source: Next, add CORP\Install as a sysadmin role to the default SQL Server instance.
trans-unit.target: Next, add CORP\Install as a sysadmin role to the default SQL Server instance.

trans-unit.source: In Object Explorer, right-click Logins and click New Login.
trans-unit.target: In Object Explorer, right-click Logins and click New Login.

trans-unit.source: Type CORP\Install in Login name.
trans-unit.target: Type CORP\Install in Login name.

trans-unit.source: In the Server Roles page, select sysadmin.
trans-unit.target: In the Server Roles page, select sysadmin.

trans-unit.source: Then, click OK.
trans-unit.target: Then, click OK.

trans-unit.source: Once the login is created, you can see it by expanding Logins in Object Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Once the login is created, you can see it by expanding Logins in Object Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Next, you create a firewall rule for SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Next, you create a firewall rule for SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: From the Start screen, launch Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.
trans-unit.target: From the Start screen, launch Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select Inbound Rules.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select Inbound Rules.

trans-unit.source: On the right pane, click New Rule.
trans-unit.target: On the right pane, click New Rule.

trans-unit.source: In the Rule Type page, select Program, then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Rule Type page, select Program, then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Program page, select This program path and type %ProgramFiles%\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL12.MSSQLSERVER\MSSQL\Binn\sqlservr.exe in the text box (if you are following these directions but using SQL Server 2012, the SQL Server directory is MSSQL11.MSSQLSERVER).
trans-unit.target: In the Program page, select This program path and type %ProgramFiles%\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL12.MSSQLSERVER\MSSQL\Binn\sqlservr.exe in the text box (if you are following these directions but using SQL Server 2012, the SQL Server directory is MSSQL11.MSSQLSERVER).

trans-unit.source: Then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Action page, keep Allow the connection selected and click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Action page, keep Allow the connection selected and click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Profile page, accept the default settings and click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Profile page, accept the default settings and click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Name page, specify a rule name, such as SQL Server (Program Rule) in the Name text box, then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: In the Name page, specify a rule name, such as SQL Server (Program Rule) in the Name text box, then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: Next, you enable the AlwaysOn Availability Groups feature.
trans-unit.target: Next, you enable the AlwaysOn Availability Groups feature.

trans-unit.source: From the Start screen, launch SQL Server Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: From the Start screen, launch SQL Server Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the browser tree, click SQL Server Services, then right-click the SQL Server (MSSQLSERVER) service and click Properties.
trans-unit.target: In the browser tree, click SQL Server Services, then right-click the SQL Server (MSSQLSERVER) service and click Properties.

trans-unit.source: Click the AlwaysOn High Availability tab, then select Enable AlwaysOn Availability Groups, as shown below, and then click Apply.
trans-unit.target: Click the AlwaysOn High Availability tab, then select Enable AlwaysOn Availability Groups, as shown below, and then click Apply.

trans-unit.source: Click OK in the pop-up dialog, and do not close the properties window yet.
trans-unit.target: Click OK in the pop-up dialog, and do not close the properties window yet.

trans-unit.source: You will restart the SQL Server service after you change the service account.
trans-unit.target: You will restart the SQL Server service after you change the service account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable AlwaysOn Availability Groups</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable AlwaysOn Availability Groups</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next, you change the SQL Server service account.
trans-unit.target: Next, you change the SQL Server service account.

trans-unit.source: Click the Log On tab, then type CORP\SQLSvc1 (for ContosoSQL1) or CORP\SQLSvc2 (for ContosoSQL2) in Account Name, then fill in and confirm the password, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click the Log On tab, then type CORP\SQLSvc1 (for ContosoSQL1) or CORP\SQLSvc2 (for ContosoSQL2) in Account Name, then fill in and confirm the password, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up window, click Yes to restart the SQL Server service.
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up window, click Yes to restart the SQL Server service.

trans-unit.source: After the SQL Server service is restarted, the changes you made in the properties window are effective.
trans-unit.target: After the SQL Server service is restarted, the changes you made in the properties window are effective.

trans-unit.source: Log out of the VMs.
trans-unit.target: Log out of the VMs.

trans-unit.source: Create the Availability Group
trans-unit.target: Create the Availability Group

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to configure an availability group.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to configure an availability group.

trans-unit.source: Below is an outline of what you will do:
trans-unit.target: Below is an outline of what you will do:

trans-unit.source: Create a new database (MyDB1) on ContosoSQL1
trans-unit.target: Create a new database (MyDB1) on ContosoSQL1

trans-unit.source: Take both a full backup and a transaction log backup of the database
trans-unit.target: Take both a full backup and a transaction log backup of the database

trans-unit.source: Restore the full and log backups to ContosoSQL2 with the NORECOVERY option
trans-unit.target: Restore the full and log backups to ContosoSQL2 with the NORECOVERY option

trans-unit.source: Create the availability group (AG1) with synchronous commit, automatic failover, and readable secondary replicas
trans-unit.target: Create the availability group (AG1) with synchronous commit, automatic failover, and readable secondary replicas

trans-unit.source: Create the MyDB1 database on ContosoSQL1:
trans-unit.target: Create the MyDB1 database on ContosoSQL1:

trans-unit.source: If you have not already logged out of the remote desktop sessions for ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2, do so now.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already logged out of the remote desktop sessions for ContosoSQL1 and ContosoSQL2, do so now.

trans-unit.source: Launch the RDP file for ContosoSQL1 and log in as CORP\Install.
trans-unit.target: Launch the RDP file for ContosoSQL1 and log in as CORP\Install.

trans-unit.source: In File Explorer, under C:\, create a directory called backup.
trans-unit.target: In File Explorer, under C:\, create a directory called backup.

trans-unit.source: You will use this directory use to back up and restore your database.
trans-unit.target: You will use this directory use to back up and restore your database.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the new directory, point to Share with, and then click Specific people, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the new directory, point to Share with, and then click Specific people, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a Backup Folder</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a Backup Folder</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Add CORP\SQLSvc1 and give it the Read/Write permission, then add CORP\SQLSvc2 and give it the Read permission, as shown below, and then click Share.
trans-unit.target: Add CORP\SQLSvc1 and give it the Read/Write permission, then add CORP\SQLSvc2 and give it the Read permission, as shown below, and then click Share.

trans-unit.source: Once the file sharing process is complete, click Done.
trans-unit.target: Once the file sharing process is complete, click Done.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Grant Permissions For Backup Folder</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Grant Permissions For Backup Folder</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next, you create the database.
trans-unit.target: Next, you create the database.

trans-unit.source: From the Start menu, launch SQL Server Management Studio, then click Connect to connect to the default SQL Server instance.
trans-unit.target: From the Start menu, launch SQL Server Management Studio, then click Connect to connect to the default SQL Server instance.

trans-unit.source: In the Object Explorer, right-click Databases and click New Database.
trans-unit.target: In the Object Explorer, right-click Databases and click New Database.

trans-unit.source: In Database name, type MyDB1, then click OK.
trans-unit.target: In Database name, type MyDB1, then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Take a full backup of MyDB1 and restore it on ContosoSQL2:
trans-unit.target: Take a full backup of MyDB1 and restore it on ContosoSQL2:

trans-unit.source: Next, you take a full backup of the database.
trans-unit.target: Next, you take a full backup of the database.

trans-unit.source: In the Object Explorer, expand Databases, then right-click MyDB1, then point to Tasks, and then click Back Up.
trans-unit.target: In the Object Explorer, expand Databases, then right-click MyDB1, then point to Tasks, and then click Back Up.

trans-unit.source: In the Source section, keep Backup type set to Full.
trans-unit.target: In the Source section, keep Backup type set to Full.

trans-unit.source: In the Destination section, click Remove to remove the default file path for the backup file.
trans-unit.target: In the Destination section, click Remove to remove the default file path for the backup file.

trans-unit.source: In the Destination section, click Add.
trans-unit.target: In the Destination section, click Add.

trans-unit.source: In the File name text box, type \\ContosoSQL1\backup\MyDB1.bak.
trans-unit.target: In the File name text box, type \\ContosoSQL1\backup\MyDB1.bak.

trans-unit.source: Then, click OK, and then click OK again to backup the database.
trans-unit.target: Then, click OK, and then click OK again to backup the database.

trans-unit.source: When the backup operation completes, click OK again to close the dialog.
trans-unit.target: When the backup operation completes, click OK again to close the dialog.

trans-unit.source: Next, you take a transaction log backup of the database.
trans-unit.target: Next, you take a transaction log backup of the database.

trans-unit.source: In the Object Explorer, expand Databases, then right-click MyDB1, then point to Tasks, and then click Back Up.
trans-unit.target: In the Object Explorer, expand Databases, then right-click MyDB1, then point to Tasks, and then click Back Up.

trans-unit.source: In Backup type, select Transaction Log.
trans-unit.target: In Backup type, select Transaction Log.

trans-unit.source: Keep the Destination file path set to the one you specified earlier and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Keep the Destination file path set to the one you specified earlier and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Once the backup operation completes, click OK again.
trans-unit.target: Once the backup operation completes, click OK again.

trans-unit.source: Next, you restore the full and transaction log backups on ContosoSQL2.
trans-unit.target: Next, you restore the full and transaction log backups on ContosoSQL2.

trans-unit.source: Launch the RDP file for ContosoSQL2 and log in as CORP\Install.
trans-unit.target: Launch the RDP file for ContosoSQL2 and log in as CORP\Install.

trans-unit.source: Leave the remote desktop session for ContosoSQL1 open.
trans-unit.target: Leave the remote desktop session for ContosoSQL1 open.

trans-unit.source: From the Start menu, launch SQL Server Management Studio, then click Connect to connect to the default SQL Server instance.
trans-unit.target: From the Start menu, launch SQL Server Management Studio, then click Connect to connect to the default SQL Server instance.

trans-unit.source: In the Object Explorer, right-click Databases and click Restore Database.
trans-unit.target: In the Object Explorer, right-click Databases and click Restore Database.

trans-unit.source: In the Source section, select Device, and click the … button.
trans-unit.target: In the Source section, select Device, and click the … button.

trans-unit.source: In Select backup devices, click Add.
trans-unit.target: In Select backup devices, click Add.

trans-unit.source: In Backup file location, type \\ContosoSQL1\backup, then click Refresh, then select MyDB1.bak, then click OK, and then click OK again.
trans-unit.target: In Backup file location, type \\ContosoSQL1\backup, then click Refresh, then select MyDB1.bak, then click OK, and then click OK again.

trans-unit.source: You should now see the full backup and the log backup in the Backup sets to restore pane.
trans-unit.target: You should now see the full backup and the log backup in the Backup sets to restore pane.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Options page, then select RESTORE WITH NORECOVERY in Recovery state, and then click OK to restore the database.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Options page, then select RESTORE WITH NORECOVERY in Recovery state, and then click OK to restore the database.

trans-unit.source: Once the restore operation completes, click OK.
trans-unit.target: Once the restore operation completes, click OK.

trans-unit.source: Create the availability group:
trans-unit.target: Create the availability group:

trans-unit.source: Go back to the remote desktop session for ContosoSQL1.
trans-unit.target: Go back to the remote desktop session for ContosoSQL1.

trans-unit.source: In the Object Explorer in SSMS, right-click AlwaysOn High Availability and click New Availability Group Wizard, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: In the Object Explorer in SSMS, right-click AlwaysOn High Availability and click New Availability Group Wizard, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Launch New Availability Group Wizard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Launch New Availability Group Wizard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Introduction page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Introduction page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Specify Availability Group Name page, type AG1 in Availability group name, then click Next again.
trans-unit.target: In the Specify Availability Group Name page, type AG1 in Availability group name, then click Next again.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Specify AG Name</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Specify AG Name</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Select Databases page, select MyDB1 and click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Select Databases page, select MyDB1 and click Next.

trans-unit.source: The database meets the prerequisites for an availability group because you have taken at least one full backup on the intended primary replica.
trans-unit.target: The database meets the prerequisites for an availability group because you have taken at least one full backup on the intended primary replica.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Select Databases</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Select Databases</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Specify Replicas page, click Add Replica.
trans-unit.target: In the Specify Replicas page, click Add Replica.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Specify Replicas</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Specify Replicas</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Connect to Server dialog pops up.
trans-unit.target: The Connect to Server dialog pops up.

trans-unit.source: Type ContosoSQL2 in Server name, then click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Type ContosoSQL2 in Server name, then click Connect.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Connect to Server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Connect to Server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Back in the Specify Replicas page, you should now see ContosoSQL2 listed in Available Replicas.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Specify Replicas page, you should now see ContosoSQL2 listed in Available Replicas.

trans-unit.source: Configure the replicas as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Configure the replicas as shown below.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished, click Next.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished, click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Specify Replicas (Complete)</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Specify Replicas (Complete)</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Select Initial Data Synchronization page, select Join only and click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Select Initial Data Synchronization page, select Join only and click Next.

trans-unit.source: You have already performed data synchronization manually when you took the full and transaction backups on ContosoSQL1 and restored them on ContosoSQL2.
trans-unit.target: You have already performed data synchronization manually when you took the full and transaction backups on ContosoSQL1 and restored them on ContosoSQL2.

trans-unit.source: You can instead choose not to perform the backup and restore operations on your database and select Full to let the New Availability Group Wizard perform data synchronization for you.
trans-unit.target: You can instead choose not to perform the backup and restore operations on your database and select Full to let the New Availability Group Wizard perform data synchronization for you.

trans-unit.source: However, this is not recommended for very large databases that are found in some enterprises.
trans-unit.target: However, this is not recommended for very large databases that are found in some enterprises.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Select Initial Data Synchronization</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Select Initial Data Synchronization</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Validation page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Validation page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: This page should look similar to below.
trans-unit.target: This page should look similar to below.

trans-unit.source: There is a warning for the listener configuration because you have not configured an availability group listener.
trans-unit.target: There is a warning for the listener configuration because you have not configured an availability group listener.

trans-unit.source: You can ignore this warning, because this tutorial does not configure a listener.
trans-unit.target: You can ignore this warning, because this tutorial does not configure a listener.

trans-unit.source: To configure the listener after completing this tutorial, see <link><linkText>Configure an ILB listener for AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To configure the listener after completing this tutorial, see <link><linkText>Configure an ILB listener for AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Validation</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Validation</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Summary page, click Finish, then wait while the wizard configures the new availability group.
trans-unit.target: In the Summary page, click Finish, then wait while the wizard configures the new availability group.

trans-unit.source: In the Progress page, you can click More details to view the detailed progress.
trans-unit.target: In the Progress page, you can click More details to view the detailed progress.

trans-unit.source: Once the wizard is finished, inspect the Results page to verify that the availability group is successfully created, as shown below, then click Close to exit the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Once the wizard is finished, inspect the Results page to verify that the availability group is successfully created, as shown below, then click Close to exit the wizard.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Results</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New AG Wizard, Results</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Object Explorer, expand AlwaysOn High Availability, then expand Availability Groups.
trans-unit.target: In the Object Explorer, expand AlwaysOn High Availability, then expand Availability Groups.

trans-unit.source: You should now see the new availability group in this container.
trans-unit.target: You should now see the new availability group in this container.

trans-unit.source: Right-click AG1 (Primary) and click Show Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Right-click AG1 (Primary) and click Show Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Show AG Dashboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Show AG Dashboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Your AlwaysOn Dashboard should look similar to the one shown below.
trans-unit.target: Your AlwaysOn Dashboard should look similar to the one shown below.

trans-unit.source: You can see the replicas, the failover mode of each replica and the synchronization state.
trans-unit.target: You can see the replicas, the failover mode of each replica and the synchronization state.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>AG Dashboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>AG Dashboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Return to Server Manager, select Tools, and then launch Failover Cluster Manager.
trans-unit.target: Return to Server Manager, select Tools, and then launch Failover Cluster Manager.

trans-unit.source: Expand Cluster1.corp.contoso.com, and then expand Services and applications.
trans-unit.target: Expand Cluster1.corp.contoso.com, and then expand Services and applications.

trans-unit.source: Select Roles and note that the AG1 availability group role has been created.
trans-unit.target: Select Roles and note that the AG1 availability group role has been created.

trans-unit.source: Note that AG1 does not have any IP address by which database clients can connect to the availability group, because you did not configure a listener.
trans-unit.target: Note that AG1 does not have any IP address by which database clients can connect to the availability group, because you did not configure a listener.

trans-unit.source: You can connect directly to the primary node for read-write operations and the secondary node for read-only queries.
trans-unit.target: You can connect directly to the primary node for read-write operations and the secondary node for read-only queries.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>AG in Failover Cluster Manager</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>AG in Failover Cluster Manager</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Do not try to fail over the availability group from the Failover Cluster Manager.
trans-unit.target: Do not try to fail over the availability group from the Failover Cluster Manager.

trans-unit.source: All failover operations should be performed from within AlwaysOn Dashboard in SSMS.
trans-unit.target: All failover operations should be performed from within AlwaysOn Dashboard in SSMS.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Restrictions on Using The WSFC Failover Cluster Manager with Availability Groups</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Restrictions on Using The WSFC Failover Cluster Manager with Availability Groups</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: You have now successfully implemented SQL Server AlwaysOn by creating an availability group in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You have now successfully implemented SQL Server AlwaysOn by creating an availability group in Azure.

trans-unit.source: To configure a listener for this availability group, see <link><linkText>Configure an ILB listener for AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To configure a listener for this availability group, see <link><linkText>Configure an ILB listener for AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For other information about using SQL Server in Azure, see <link><linkText>SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For other information about using SQL Server in Azure, see <link><linkText>SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
